newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Single market council set to adopt tractor directive.
newsitem.headline: Single market council set to adopt tractor directive.

text.p: The Single Market Council is expected to adopt on Thursday a common position on a directive which would enable farmers in all EU states to use tractors which can travel at 40 kph, EU officials said.
The European Parliament approved the plan last December.
In June, the European Commission proposed a revision of European type-approval directives approved between 1974 and 1989, so as to increase the maximum permitted speed for tractors from 30 to 40 kph.
The proposal, which has the support of tractor manufacturers, requires the approval of both parliament and ministers to become law.
The proposal is seen as important by most member states so that the majority of tractors currently built and/or marketed in the EU could benefit from the EU type approval system.
Since 1990, manufacturers have been able to obtain EU type approval, which are recognised throughout the EU.
